16  * Routines specific to the Halide OpenCL runtime.
17  */
18 
19 #define HALIDE_RUNTIME_OPENCL

21 extern const struct halide_device_interface_t *halide_opencl_device_interface();
22 extern const struct halide_device_interface_t *halide_opencl_image_device_interface();

24 /** These are forward declared here to allow clients to override the
25  * Halide OpenCL runtime. Do not call them. */
26 // @{
27 extern int halide_opencl_initialize_kernels(void *user_context, void **state_ptr,
28  const char *src, int size);
29 extern int halide_opencl_run(void *user_context,
30  void *state_ptr,
31  const char *entry_name,
32  int blocksX, int blocksY, int blocksZ,
33  int threadsX, int threadsY, int threadsZ,

39  float *vertex_buffer,
40  int num_coords_dim0,
41  int num_coords_dim1);
42 extern void halide_opencl_finalize_kernels(void *user_context, void *state_ptr);
43 // @}
44 
45 /** Set the platform name for OpenCL to use (e.g. "Intel" or
46  * "NVIDIA"). The argument is copied internally. The opencl runtime
47  * will select a platform that includes this as a substring. If never
48  * called, Halide uses the environment variable HL_OCL_PLATFORM_NAME,
49  * or defaults to the first available platform. */
50 extern void halide_opencl_set_platform_name(const char *n);
51 
52 /** Halide calls this to get the desired OpenCL platform
53  * name. Implement this yourself to use a different platform per
54  * user_context. The default implementation returns the value set by
55  * halide_set_ocl_platform_name, or the value of the environment
56  * variable HL_OCL_PLATFORM_NAME. The output is valid until the next
57  * call to halide_set_ocl_platform_name. */
58 extern const char *halide_opencl_get_platform_name(void *user_context);
59 
60 /** Set the device type for OpenCL to use. The argument is copied
61  * internally. It must be "cpu", "gpu", or "acc". If never called,
62  * Halide uses the environment variable HL_OCL_DEVICE_TYPE. */
63 extern void halide_opencl_set_device_type(const char *n);
64 
65 /** Halide calls this to gets the desired OpenCL device
66  * type. Implement this yourself to use a different device type per
67  * user_context. The default implementation returns the value set by
68  * halide_set_ocl_device_type, or the environment variable
69  * HL_OCL_DEVICE_TYPE. The result is valid until the next call to
70  * halide_set_ocl_device_type. */
71 extern const char *halide_opencl_get_device_type(void *user_context);
72 
73 /** Set the additional build options for OpenCL to use. The argument
74  * is copied internally. If never called,
75  * Halide uses the environment variable HL_OCL_BUILD_OPTIONS. */
76 extern void halide_opencl_set_build_options(const char *n);
77 
78 /** Halide calls this to gets the additional build options for OpenCL to
79  * use. Implement this yourself to use a different build options per
80  * user_context. The default implementation returns the value set by
81  * halide_opencl_set_build_options, or the environment variable
82  * HL_OCL_BUILD_OPTIONS. The result is valid until the next call to
83  * halide_opencl_set_build_options. */
84 extern const char *halide_opencl_get_build_options(void *user_context);
85 
86 /** Set the underlying cl_mem for a halide_buffer_t. This memory should be
87  * allocated using clCreateBuffer or similar and must have an extent
88  * large enough to cover that specified by the halide_buffer_t extent
89  * fields. The dev field of the halide_buffer_t must be NULL when this
90  * routine is called. This call can fail due to running out of memory
91  * or being passed an invalid device pointer. The device and host
92  * dirty bits are left unmodified. */
93 extern int halide_opencl_wrap_cl_mem(void *user_context, struct halide_buffer_t *buf, uint64_t device_ptr);
94 
95 /** Same as halide_opencl_wrap_cl_mem but wraps a cl_mem created with
96  * clCreateImage
97  */
98 extern int halide_opencl_image_wrap_cl_mem(void *user_context, struct halide_buffer_t *buf, uint64_t device_ptr);
99 
100 /** Disconnect a halide_buffer_t from the memory it was previously
101  * wrapped around. Should only be called for a halide_buffer_t that
102  * halide_opencl_wrap_device_ptr was previously called on. Frees any
103  * storage associated with the binding of the halide_buffer_t and the
104  * device pointer, but does not free the cl_mem. The dev field of the
105  * halide_buffer_t will be NULL on return.
106  */
107 extern int halide_opencl_detach_cl_mem(void *user_context, struct halide_buffer_t *buf);
108 
109 /** Return the underlying cl_mem for a halide_buffer_t. This buffer must be
110  * valid on an OpenCL device, or not have any associated device
111  * memory. If there is no device memory (dev field is NULL), this
112  * returns 0.
113  */
114 extern uintptr_t halide_opencl_get_cl_mem(void *user_context, struct halide_buffer_t *buf);
115 
116 /** Returns the offset associated with the OpenCL memory allocation via device_crop or device_slice. */
117 extern uint64_t halide_opencl_get_crop_offset(void *user_context, halide_buffer_t *buf);
118

HalideRuntime.h
This file declares the routines used by Halide internally in its runtime.
